title_full: MLSUS01-BP01 Optimize model training efficiency to reduce energy consumption
title: Optimize model training efficiency to reduce energy consumption
description: Reduce training energy consumption by optimizing hyperparameters, using efficient model architectures, and implementing early stopping. Use transfer learning and fine-tuning instead of training from scratch when possible. Monitor GPU utilization and reduce idle compute time.

title_full: MLSUS01-BP02 Use efficient hardware for ML workloads
title: Use efficient hardware for ML workloads
description: Select energy-efficient instance types for ML workloads including AWS Trainium for training and AWS Inferentia for inference. Use purpose-built ML accelerators that provide better performance per watt compared to general-purpose GPUs. Consider the carbon footprint of different instance types.

title_full: MLSUS01-BP03 Deploy workloads in Regions with lower carbon intensity
title: Deploy workloads in Regions with lower carbon intensity
description: Consider deploying ML workloads in AWS Regions powered by renewable energy when latency requirements allow. Use the AWS Customer Carbon Footprint Tool to track and reduce carbon emissions from ML workloads. Balance carbon footprint considerations with performance and data residency requirements.

title_full: MLSUS02-BP01 Optimize model size and complexity for inference
title: Optimize model size and complexity for inference
description: Apply model compression techniques including quantization, pruning, and knowledge distillation to reduce model size and inference compute requirements. Use SageMaker Neo to optimize models for target hardware. Balance model accuracy against energy consumption.

title_full: MLSUS02-BP02 Right-size inference endpoints to minimize idle resources
title: Right-size inference endpoints to minimize idle resources
description: Configure auto scaling for inference endpoints to scale down during low-traffic periods. Use serverless inference for intermittent workloads to eliminate always-on compute. Monitor endpoint utilization and remove or consolidate underutilized endpoints.

title_full: MLSUS03-BP01 Implement efficient data storage and processing
title: Implement efficient data storage and processing
description: Use efficient data formats and compression to reduce storage footprint and data transfer. Implement data lifecycle policies to archive or delete unused data. Minimize data duplication by using centralized data stores and feature stores.

title_full: MLSUS03-BP02 Use incremental training and caching to reduce redundant computation
title: Use incremental training and caching to reduce redundant computation
description: Implement incremental training to update models with new data rather than retraining from scratch. Cache preprocessed data and intermediate results to avoid redundant computation. Use feature stores to share computed features across models and teams.

title_full: MLSUS04-BP01 Track and report ML workload sustainability metrics
title: Track and report ML workload sustainability metrics
description: Monitor and report sustainability metrics for ML workloads including compute utilization, energy consumption estimates, and carbon footprint. Use AWS Customer Carbon Footprint Tool to track emissions. Set sustainability goals and track progress over time.

title_full: MLSUS04-BP02 Establish sustainability considerations in ML development processes
title: Establish sustainability considerations in ML development processes
description: Incorporate sustainability criteria into ML project planning and model selection decisions. Consider the environmental impact of training large models versus using smaller, more efficient alternatives. Document sustainability tradeoffs in model development decisions.
